recommendations.recommendation: I`m not sure why this has such a low rating. It`s actually really good. In fact, it`s the best adventure anime I`ve seen. Very good story, nice characters, and it`s fun and enjoyable to watch. If you like adventure anime, watch it regardless of the rating. I`m a big action fan; however the action isn`t it`s greatest point. Even so, it`s still near 10/10 in my opinion.

anime.description: * Based on the book series of the same name by http://anidb.net/cr10164 [Emily Rodda]. Deltora is a land of Monsters and Magic... The evil Shadow Lord is plotting to invade Deltora and enslave its people. All that stands against him is the magic Belt of Deltora with its seven gems of great and mysterious power. When the gems are stolen and hidden in dark, terrible places throughout the kingdom, the Shadow Lord triumphs and Deltora is lost. In secrecy, with only a hand-drawn map to guide them, two unlikely companions set out on a perilous quest. Determined to find the lost gems and rid their land of the tyrant, they struggle towards their first goal - the sinister Forests of Silence.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Lief
character.description: Lief grew up in a land ruled by the evil Shadow Lord - never figuring that someday he`d save the kingdom. Lief was just a kid rebelling against the Grey Guards, until he turned 16 and his father, Jarred, gave him the magical Belt of Deltora. With only his sword and a magic cloak made by his mother, Anna, Lief takes up a quest that leads him to Deltora`s deepest, darkest places.

character.name: Barda
character.description: Barda is a former palace guard who was wounded when the Shadow Lord attacked the castle. Taken in by Jarred, Lief`s father, Barda spent years pretending to be a beggar outside their home. After secretly saving the boy from the Grey Guards again and again, Barda now protects Lief on his quest to find the seven stolen gems and save Deltora from the Shadow Lord.

character.name: Jasmine
character.description: Jasmine met Lief and Barda in the Forests of Silence, where she helped them find the first gem and joined them on their quest. Jasmine`s a smart, sassy orphan who has a strong link to the trees and animals she grew up with. She`s used to being on her own - but she`s always had her friends Kree the raven and little furry Filli.

episode.title: リーフ冒険の旅へ
The Adventure Begins
Lief Bouken no Tabi e
episode.summary: A young warrior sets out to rid his homeland of its evil conqueror. In the opener, Lief and his guardian, Barda, embark on their quest to locate the seven gems necessary to free Deltora from the Shadow Lord. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 森の少女ジャスミン
Jasmine, Girl of the Forests
Mori no Shoujo Jasmine
episode.summary: Danger surrounds Lief and Barda in the Forests of Silence as they meet a mysterious girl while searching for hidden gems. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黄金の騎士ゴール
The Golden Knight
Ougon no Kishi Gorl
episode.summary: Jasmine leads Lief and Barda to a giant knight in the forest who believes they have come to rob him. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ナゾナゾ巨人の呪い
The Enigmatic Giant
Nazonazo Kyojin no Noroi
episode.summary: Lief heads for the Lake of Tears, but he must first journey though Thaegan`s land and solve riddles posed by her guard. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ニジとドッジのわな
Nij and Doj`s Trap
Nij to Doj no Wana
episode.summary: Lief and his friends are chased by Grey Guards because they rescued a Ralad man. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 嘆きの湖にすむ怪物
The Monster in the Lake of Tears
Nageki no Mizuumi ni Sumu Kaibutsu
episode.summary: Manus guides Lief to the Lake of Tears by way of his homeland, where they learn a surprising truth. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔女テーガン現る
Sorceress Thaegan
Majo Thaegan Arawaru
episode.summary: Lief tries to take the gem from Soldeen, a giant monster, but is interrupted by Thaegen, an evil sorceress. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トムのふしぎな店
Tom`s Curious Shop
Tom no Fushigi na Mise
episode.summary: Lief and his friends move on toward the next destination after defeating the Thaegan Sorceress, but Lief realizes they are being followed when the belt signals danger and Jasmine gets a bad feeling. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クリーンチュルナイ!
Noradz the Clean
Clean Churunai!
episode.summary: Lief and his friends are stuck in Noradz, whose residents clean obsessively and whose ruler wants Lief and his friends to stay. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 牢獄からの脱出
Escape
Rougoku kara no Dasshutsu
episode.summary: Lief and his friends must fight their way out of Noradz after escaping from a dungeon, in which they`d been imprisoned. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: はばひろ川を渡れ
Cross the River
Habahiro Kawa o Watare
episode.summary: Lief and his friends escape from Noradz hidden in a food wagon that takes them to Tom`s store, where they learn that the Shadow Lord rules over Noradz. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ラット・シティの王
The King of the Rats
Rat City no Ou
episode.summary: The group searches for the third gem in the City of Rats and encounters Reeah, a giant snake that guards the city`s towers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: エンドンとジャード
Endon and Jarred
Endon to Jarred
episode.summary: Lief and his friends evacuate from the City of Rats. While resting by the Broad River, Lief shares the story of his father and King Endon with Jasmine. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: うばわれた宝石
The Stolen Gems
Ubawareta Houseki
episode.summary: Lief tells the story of his father, Jarred; King Endon; and Queen Sharn, who have all vowed to one day recover the belt`s stolen gems. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 運がいい? わるい?
Good Luck! Bad Luck!
Un ga Ii? Warui?
episode.summary: A festival in Rithmere draws the attention of Lief and his friends, who try to win 100 gold coins by participating in its Games. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リスメア競技大会
The Rithmere Games
Rithmere Kyougi Taikai
episode.summary: Lief and his friends are in danger of missing the games when they are locked in their rooms at the inn and threatened by a stranger. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦え! 戦えリーフ
Test of Endurance
Tatakae! Tatakae Lief
episode.summary: Lief and his friends get advice before they compete in the final round of the games. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ジャスミンと謎の男
Jasmine vs. Doom
Jasmine to Nazo no Otoko
episode.summary: Jasmine is forced to compete in the last round of the games after discovering that some of her opponents have been poisoned. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: レジスタンスの少年
The Boy From the Resistance
Resistance no Shounen
episode.summary: The Grey Guards attack Lief and his friends as they journey to the Shifting Sands, but help comes from an unexpected source. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: うごめく砂の怪物
The Shifting Sands
Ugomeku Suna no Kaibutsu
episode.summary: The Grey Guards continue their pursuit as Lief and the others search for the fourth gem in the Shifting Sands, where they meet Terreocti, the Sand Beast. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 神の石ラピスラズリ
The Heavenly Stone
Kami no Ishi Lapislazuli
episode.summary: Lief loses consciousness after a swarm of bees attacks him, and he receives advice about his quest from his parents while he dreams. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔女テーガンの復活
Thaegan`s Return
Majo Thaegan no Fukkatsu
episode.summary: The sorceress Thaegan is revived by the Shadow Lord and vows revenge against Lief, who continues on his journey. Meanwhile, Jasmine has doubts about Francoise. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恐怖テーガンのわな
Thaegan`s Trap
Kyoufu Thaegan no Wana
episode.summary: Lief and his friends find Francoise`s mother in the palace, but they end up trapped after Thaegen tricks them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: プリンとの出会い
Meeting Prin
Purin to no Deai
episode.summary: Lief has a nightmare that reveals a door bearing the Shadow Lord`s mark after he and his friends drink from the Dreaming Spring on their way to Dread Mountain. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 急襲! 怪物ブラール
Vraal Attack!
Kyuushuu! Kaibutu Vraal
episode.summary: Lief and his friends avoid gnomes and arrive at Dread Mountain, where they encounter the Grey Guards and a powerful monster. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キンよ飛べ! 大空へ
Kin to the Air
Kin yo Tobe! Oozora e
episode.summary: Lief`s resolve is renewed after he dreams about his parents. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恐怖の山にひそむ者
Trapped Under Dread Mountain
Kyoufu no Yama ni Hisomu Mono
episode.summary: Prin helps Lief`s group defeat Vraal and leads them through the Boolong Forest, where the gnomes seal them in a cave. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 巨大ゲリックを倒せ
The Great Gellick!
Kyodai Gellick o Taose
episode.summary: The trapped group learn they are being observed in the cave, and they devise a plan to trick their captors, escape and find the fifth gem. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カーン部隊を叩け!
The End of the Carn Squad?
Carn Butai o Hatake!
episode.summary: The group leave Dread Mountain with the fifth gem but are caught in thick fog as the Grey Guards pursue them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新たなる怪物オル
The Mysterious Ols
Aratanaru Kaibutsu Ols
episode.summary: Dain saves Lief`s life when the group is attacked on the way to the Maze of the Beast. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: さよならジャスミン
Goodbye, Jasmine
Sayonara Jasmine
episode.summary: Lief and his friends are detained at the Resistance hideout until they`re cleared of being the Shadow Lord`s Ols. Meanwhile, Jasmine decides to leave the group and travel on her own. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リバークイーン号
The River Queen
River Queen Gou
episode.summary: Jasmine leaves a secret code for Lief, which he finds when his group enters a town ransacked by Bandits. Meanwhile, their new companion Dain reveals more about himself as they travel to the Tol River. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リーフ, 危機一髪
Pirate Attack
Lief, Kikiippatsu
episode.summary: Jasmine rejoins the group on a river boat teeming with pirates and Ols. After the battle, Lief realizes that some of his friends and his belt are missing. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 盗賊たちのうたげ
The Pirates` Feast
Touzoku-tachi no Utage
episode.summary: Pirates capture Dain and steal the Belt of Deltora; the group locate a map that leads them through the Maze of the Beast and to the pirates. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 怪物グルーの洞くつ
Maze of the Beast
Kaibutsu Guruu no Doukutsu
episode.summary: Pirates lock the group in the Maze of the Beast, where a frightening monster lives, but they cannot try to escape until they find the sixth gem. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔女テーガンの逆襲
Sorceress Thaegan Is Back!
Majo Thaegan no Gyakushuu
episode.summary: Dain disappears while Lief and the others escape the Maze of the Beast with the sixth gem. While traveling through the forest, the group is watched by an unknown person. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: テーガンと子ども達
Mirror of Fear
Thaegan to Kodomotachi
episode.summary: Lief`s friends are captured by Thaegan, and Lief must consider putting his quest on hold in order to save them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔導士オーカス現る
Sorcerer Oacus
Mashirubeshi Oacus Genru
episode.summary: The group lose a member of their party while traveling to the Valley of the Lost. Harassed by the Shadow Lord`s minions, they take another route. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トーラ族の誓い
The Vow of the Torans
Torans Zoku no Chikai
episode.summary: The group is swept along the River Tor to the City of Tora, where Dain`s footsteps lead them through the city walls even though the Grey Guards are following them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: いましめの谷の番人
The Valley of the Lost
Imashime no Tani no Bannin
episode.summary: In the Valley of the Lost, Lief must play a game to win the seventh gem. While playing, he learns shocking news. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最後のダイヤモンド
The Last Gem
Saigo no Diamond
episode.summary: The identity of the seventh gem`s guardian stuns the group, who enter a tough battle to protect the belt and obtain the gem. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ベタクサ村の攻防
Battle at Withick Mire
Betakusa Musa no Koubou
episode.summary: Lief uses the Dreaming Spring to investigate a traitorous transfer of information from the gathering to the Shadow Lord. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スカール大暴走!
Nevets Goes Wild
Score Dai Bousou
episode.summary: Danger awaits the group as they head for the gathering place where the seven tribes must meet to restore the Belt of Deltora`s power. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 七つの宝石が集う時
The Seven Gems United
Nanatsu no Houseki ga Tsudou Toki
episode.summary: The group must locate the royal heir after finding the last of the seven gems. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リーフ, 誓いの儀式
The Oath
Lief, Chikai no Gishiki
episode.summary: A spy remains undetected among the united seven tribes. Lief is concerned but focuses on the pledging ceremony in hopes that the royal heir will be found. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 進撃せよ!七部族
The Seven Tribes!
Shingeki seyo! Nana Buzoku
episode.summary: Lief`s group encounters others in need in the Palace while rescuing Dain, but helping them could turn their mission into a trap. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宿敵オーカスの最後
The Last Battle of Fire
Shukuteki Oacus no Saigo
episode.summary: Lief and the others plan to sneak into the Palace of Del to rescue Dain, who has been kidnapped, but they are attacked by an enemy believed beaten in the Valley of the Lost. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決死の救出作戦
The Fight for Freedom
Kesshi no Kyuushutsu Sakusen
episode.summary: Jasmine makes a personal discovery as Lief comes to her rescue at the castle while being pursued by the Grey Guards. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 親友デインの正体
Who is Dain?
Shinyuu de In no Shoutai
episode.summary: As an army of Ols attack, Lief and the others finally find out who`s been leaking information about them to the Shadow Lord. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦アクババ軍団
Battle of the Ak-Babas
Kessen Aku Baba Gundan
episode.summary: The forces of evil try to keep Lief from completing his quest and saving his kingdom Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 真実の世継ぎは誰?
Who`s the Next King?
Shinjitsu no Yotsugi wa Dare?
episode.summary: Lief must make a choice that may have severe consequences; a battle erupts after the citizens and the Resistance enter the unrest. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 七つの宝石の輝く時
When the Seven Gems Shine
Nanatsu no Houseki no Kagayaku Toki
episode.summary: Lief must battle the Shadow Lord to finish his quest, after attaining the last piece of the puzzle. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トル川の盗賊たち
The Pirates of the River Tor
Torgawa no Touzoku-tachi
